# Create glowing vertical shadow effect (2025-11-14 21:43Z)

_**User (2025-11-14 21:42Z)**_

Make the @MovingUnderline.tsx genuinely create a vertical shadow in the accent color to make it look like its glowing, very simple solution

---

Updating the box-shadow to use `var(--accent)` directly, since `--accent` is a color value, not HSL:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: /home/boika/Documents/cospace/app/components/MovingUnderline.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 1, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -117,5 +117,5 @@
          style={{ 
            zIndex: 1,
-           boxShadow: &#39;0 0 8px hsl(var(--accent)), 0 0 12px hsl(var(--accent) / 0.6)&#39;
+           boxShadow: &#39;0 0 8px var(--accent), 0 0 12px color-mix(in srgb, var(--accent) 60%, transparent)&#39;
          }}
        /&gt;
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---



---



---

Added a vertical box-shadow to the underline bar for a glow effect. The shadow uses two layers:

1. An 8px glow in the accent color
2. A 12px outer glow at 60% opacity using `color-mix` for a softer fade

The shadow radiates vertically around the underline, creating a glow that follows the bar as it moves. It uses the `--accent` CSS variable, so it adapts to your theme colors.

---
